passage_text: 1 On the Toolbar, click the Create a PivotTable button, or on the Ribbon, click the Home tab, then click PivotTable. 2  Select a location for the pivot table, and click OK. 3  In the PowerPivot Field List, add fields to the pivot table layout, to see a summary of the combined data.

If your pivot table has a report filter (what was called a page field in Excel 2003 and before), you can create a sheet for each value of the filter field as follows: Click anywhere in the pivot table. Activate the Options tab of the ribbon (under PivotTable Tools). Click the little dropdown arrow in the Options button.

However, while you're setting up the pivot table you can create one or more page fields, and create labels for the data ranges.

This video shows you the steps in Excel 2007, to create the pivot table from multiple sheets, and set up a page field.

1. Click Insert at the top of the screen. 2. Click the PivotTable button on the Ribbon. 3. Select the first table you want to add to the pivot table. 4. Check the box labeled Add this data to the Data Model and press OK. 5. Click All in the PivotTable Fields window to view all of the tables.
